content: Forgive me if I sound confused and slightly ignorant of this issue, but quite frankly I am. If the retraining advisory shows that there are no slots open (in fact it doesn't show the AFSC on the advisory at all), that means that there are no open positions, correct? So if you have a retraining package up for review for that particular career field, then isn't it just a waste of an application package? It's getting ready to be sent up for review number two, but should the application just be withdrawn and we go for BOP instead while the window is open? **On a side note, at the time the application was initially submitted, there were slots available.**

content: AFSCs? Try the Air Force Thread - - http://forums.military.com/eve/forums/a/frm/f/37919558 Wandering and Wondering

title: Retraining Advisory

content: Not necessarily. Simply because there are no slots listed doesn't mean the slot isn't available. It just means that there isn't a shortage at this time in that AFSC. Your package may in fact be approved if there is a need at a differant base/Sq. On the other hand ... if you've been on your base long enough, a BOP may be the way to go if there is a need for your current AFSC at the BOP applied base. Make sense? Clear as mud I know.
reply: Not necessarily. Simply because there are no slots listed doesn't mean the slot isn't available. It just means that there isn't a shortage at this time in that AFSC. Your package may in fact be approved if there is a need at a differant base/Sq.
